intro: Eriosema corymboides, commonly known as the clustered eriosema, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its leguminous properties and nitrogen-fixing capabilities. The plant features a sprawling or shrub-like growth habit with trifoliate leaves and clusters of small, pea-like flowers. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, with hairy surfaces that give it its scientific name. Eriosema corymboides is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in well-drained soils.
